COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xf2
STRING: As always, I had a very lazy Saturday.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xfe
STRING: It was a hard-earned day of rest, so without any thought
of practice, I'd stay in bed and just read all day.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x11e
STRING: Touching the Fortelle, I remembered the song I was
working on.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x134
STRING: [Chris] “Come to think of it...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x14a
STRING: That song I wrote in the practice room wasn't finished
yet.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x156
STRING: Phorni hadn't appeared yet today, so this was probably
a good time to complete it.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x16c
STRING: I took out the unfinished score from my bag and placed
it on the desk.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x178
STRING: Then I removed my Fortelle from its case and put it next
to the desk.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x18e
STRING: I played a single note, as if to drown out the sound of
the rain hitting the window.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1fe
STRING: [Chris] “Phew... I guess it's done.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x214
STRING: I was satisfied with how the finished score turned out.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x244
STRING: [Phorni] “Hey, what's done? Don't tell me that's a new
song you just wrote?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x264
STRING: [Chris] “Ph-Phorni, when did you...?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x296
STRING: [Phorni] “Just this second, of course. Hmm?

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2c4
STRING: ... You're hiding something, aren't you...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2da
STRING: [Chris] “No... I'm not hiding anything. Just a little
surprised, that's all. I was composing.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x316
STRING: [Phorni] “Wow, this is a great song. When did you write
it?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x32c
STRING: [Chris] “Huh? Er... Very recently, I guess.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x35e
STRING: [Phorni] “Today's my first time hearing it, so you don't
mean this week, do you? You don't have that kind of
time on your hands.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x37e
STRING: [Chris] “Ah... Well, you know, things just happen,
Phorni.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3a6
STRING: [Phorni] “So it's true...? Wait, you've come back early a
few times this week, right? So when was it?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3d0
STRING: [Chris] “Those days I came back late... I guess.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x402
STRING: [Phorni] “No guessing! This song wasn't written in a day,
no way. Just to be sure... Three days?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x422
STRING: [Chris] “Uh... Monday, Wednesday and Friday, so that's
right.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x440
STRING: [Phorni] “Those are all the days you didn't come back
early! ... Ah, I give up. A whole week has gone by.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x460
STRING: [Chris] “Why are you so worried about that, Phorni? I
said it'd be okay.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x49c
STRING: [Phorni] “Where is this unfounded peace of mind
coming from? Both Torta and Arie said you had to
decide soon, right?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x4c6
STRING: [Chris] “But if I'm just playing aimlessly, there's no telling
if something good will come out of it.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x4e6
STRING: [Chris] “That's why writing songs that I want to play will
help my graduation recital, in the end.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x522
STRING: [Phorni] “That may be so, but is there anyone who'll sing
it for you?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x542
STRING: [Chris] “I'm looking for someone right now.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x574
STRING: [Phorni] “Then you're in trouble!”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x58a
STRING: [Chris] “But the song is finished. I just need to find
someone, but everyone has her own song already, so I'll
have to look somewhere else.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x5b4
STRING: [Chris] “But unfortunately, it's Saturday, so I won't find
anyone at school. Which means...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x5f0
STRING: [Phorni] “Huh...?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x606
STRING: [Chris] “I don't have anyone to practice my new song
with. What should I do?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x642
STRING: [Phorni] “Well in that case, until you find someone, I can
practice it with you?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x662
STRING: ... As I expected, Phorni.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x66e
STRING: You know just how to play along.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x67a
STRING: [Chris] “Shall we try it once, together?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x6b4
STRING: [Phorni] “Oh well, if that's how it's going to be, fine.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x6ca
STRING: Great! She's moving her wings!

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x6d6
STRING: [Chris] “What'll we do about the score? I only have one
copy.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x708
STRING: [Phorni] “That's fine. Even without the score, I'll just
follow your lead.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x728
STRING: [Chris] “Reliable as always. When it comes to singing,
that is.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x746
STRING: [Phorni] “Musical fairy here, hello?

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x774
STRING: Huh? Where are the lyrics? I don't see anything written
down...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x78a
STRING: [Chris] “Ah, I didn't think about the lyrics.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x7bc
STRING: [Phorni] “Well, what should we do? I don't like scat
singing.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x7d2
STRING: I wrote this song for Phorni.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x7de
STRING: But I'd feel embarrassed saying that, so I planned to
keep it a secret.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x7f4
STRING: I might tell her at the very end, but definitely not now.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x80a
STRING: But since it was her song, I thought it'd be good for
Phorni to get involved.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x820
STRING: Then I had an idea.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x82c
STRING: [Chris] “Hey Phorni, what if you wrote the lyrics for this
song?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x85e
STRING: [Phorni] “Huh...? M-Me?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x882
STRING: After all, there was no way I could look for a new
potential partner at that time.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x898
STRING: In other words, I didn't plan on performing with anyone
else.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x8a4
STRING: But to what end?

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x8b0
STRING: It was pointless to think about that; anyway Phorni
would sing it excellently.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x8c6
STRING: Music shouldn't be a means, but always an end in itself.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x8d2
STRING: That end is one's enjoyment of sound, and
performances such as the graduation recital, where
results are linked to the opinions of others, actually miss
the original point of music.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x8f2
STRING: That said, my graduation depended on it, so I couldn't
possibly skip it.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x908
STRING: In the real world, it'd be hard to get by just playing
what you like.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x91e
STRING: I wasn't a child, I understood that much.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x92a
STRING: But for now, I wanted to play without any care for such
things.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x940
STRING: I'd written a song for that purpose, and I'd been blessed
with a singer.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x94c
STRING: Phorni would sing the song written for Phorni.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x958
STRING: Could there be any more perfect arrangement than
this?

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x964
STRING: And so I kept selling the idea to Phorni.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x984
STRING: [Chris] “The truth is, I don't seem to have any talent for
lyrics. Asino helped me write the words to all my songs.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x9ac
STRING: [Phorni] “Is that right...? I had no idea.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x9c2
STRING: [Chris] “Well, I'm not proud of it, that's why I haven't
told you. So, are you up for it?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x9fe
STRING: [Phorni] “Hmm... I haven't written much, either, so I'm
not sure if I can do it right.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xa1e
STRING: [Chris] “That's fine, just sing whatever you want. After
all, it's impossible to write the whole thing in one go, so
how about doing it bit by bit?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xa64
STRING: [Phorni] “But... Is it okay for me to do this?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xa7a
STRING: [Chris] “Phorni, I want you to do this for me.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xaa4
STRING: Only you can do this, Phorni... I couldn't say that just
yet.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xaba
STRING: I'd tell her after the song was finished.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xac6
STRING: I was starting to look forward to that moment.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xad2
STRING: I also took pleasure in the thought that my song would
be complete once the lyrics were finished.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xae8
STRING: [Chris] “So you'll do it, Phorni?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xb1a
STRING: [Phorni] “...Okay. If you're not good at it, Chris, I'll just
have to help you out.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xb30
STRING: [Chris] “Thanks.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xb52
STRING: At first, I was just trying to distract Phorni.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xb68
STRING: But the more we talked about it, I became convinced
that this was the only way.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xb7e
STRING: She would write the words to her song.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xb8a
STRING: And Phorni herself would sing them.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xb96
STRING: Of course, this music could not be heard by anyone
else.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xba2
STRING: But that was sure to be the highest form of music.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xbae
STRING: Even if the only ones satisfied with it were Phorni and
me, I wouldn't mind.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xbc4
STRING: [Chris] “Okay, I'll play it from the start, do you want to
just listen first?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xc00
STRING: [Phorni] “...I'll sing.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xc16
STRING: [Chris] “Sure, don't worry about the lyrics for now.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xc48
STRING: [Phorni] “Not like I have a choice. Okay, let's begin.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xc92
STRING: Night fell, and still we continued practicing.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xc9e
STRING: It wouldn't do for even me to think that this was rare.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xcd0
STRING: [Phorni] “Those lyrics... I wanna change them.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xce6
STRING: [Chris] “Ha-ha, you're getting into it.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xd18
STRING: [Phorni] “Well, if I'm gonna make something, I want it to
be good.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xd2e
STRING: [Chris] “I know the feeling. Go ahead, change them.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xd4c
STRING: [Phorni] “Let's see...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xd62
STRING: [Chris] “...Mm-hmm.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xd84
STRING: I rewrote the lyrics just as Phorni said.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xd90
STRING: The words were positive, like Phorni.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xd9c
STRING: I knew I didn't have much talent for poetry, so I rarely
wrote any.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xdb2
STRING: But when I did write, I felt most of my poems were
retrospective, reflecting on the past.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xdc8
STRING: That's why this was such a fun and refreshing exercise.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xdd4
STRING: [Chris] “And that's half of it done. It's coming together
nicely, isn't it?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xe06
STRING: [Phorni] “You think so? I-I'm happy to hear that...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xe1c
STRING: [Chris] “It's not finished yet, but let's give it a go.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xe3a
STRING: [Phorni] “Okay!”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xea4
STRING: [Phorni] “Hmm, that sounds about right.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xeba
STRING: [Chris] “Yeah. It's only been one day, but we've come a
long way, huh?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xef6
STRING: [Phorni] “Hehe...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xf0c
STRING: Phorni was enjoying herself so much, she'd probably go
on to sing for me after all.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xf22
STRING: I wasn't planning on practicing my recital song over the
weekend, so I was able to genuinely enjoy our time
together.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xf38
STRING: But as Phorni said, I knew I had to take things more
seriously from next week on, so there wouldn't be many
more moments like this.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xf62
STRING: Was it possible for us to spend time like this, forever?

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xf6e
STRING: [Chris] “Anyway... One more time, from the top.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xfa0
STRING: [Phorni] “Yessir!”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1014
STRING: We'd had dinner, and it was night.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1020
STRING: I was getting tired, but couldn't find the right time to
stop.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1036
STRING: Phorni and I had just figured out how the song worked,
experimenting as we performed.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1056
STRING: As opposed to just singing, this kind of practice was
causing a little tension.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x106c
STRING: That too was enjoyable in a way, so the musician in me
was conflicted.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x109e
STRING: [Phorni] “Hmm... Perhaps the Fortelle should be a little
softer here?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x10be
STRING: [Chris] “...I see, yes, we should be emphasizing the
words there. I'll make a note in the score.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x10ec
STRING: As we had more of these discussions, the score became
messier and messier.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1102
STRING: Normally I didn't mind, but there'd been a lot of
changes to the lyrics, so it was getting very hard to
read.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1122
STRING: Phorni didn't need the score, because the music wasn't
her concern, and the lyrics were her own words.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1138
STRING: I may not have looked bothered, but I was just an
average human with no way of following this rapidly
changing song without the score.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1158
STRING: It also depended on how many more lyric edits we'd
have, but I felt the need to make at least one clean
copy of the score.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x119e
STRING: [Phorni] “What's the matter?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x11b4
STRING: [Chris] “No, it's nothing.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x11ca
STRING: Phorni would get mad if I did that at home, so I'd have
to find a practice room at school.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x11fc
STRING: [Phorni] “Hmm... Anyway, I had a really good time
today.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x121c
STRING: [Chris] “Is this the first time we've done a whole day of
ensembles? I think it's happened maybe once before...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x123c
STRING: [Chris] “I don't remember it so well, but I think it was a
while ago.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1278
STRING: [Phorni] “That was the first time we met, wasn't it? We
went on until nighttime.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1298
STRING: [Chris] “You're right. Those were good times. Has it
already been three years?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x12d4
STRING: [Phorni] “Seems like a long time ago, but then again,
maybe not.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x12ea
STRING: Phorni was getting a little sentimental, as if her mind
were elsewhere.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1300
STRING: At first, there were times when I just didn't know what
to do with her, but after we bonded through music,
those frustrations just vanished.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1320
STRING: [Chris] “We have over three months left, so this song
can be made perfect, right?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x135c
STRING: [Phorni] “Yeah, I'd say so...

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x138a
STRING: Hmm? Wait a minute, something's not right...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x13a0
STRING: [Chris] “What do you mean?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x13d2
STRING: [Phorni] “Finishing the song isn't the goal! What you
need to do now, Chris, is to sit down and practice hard
for the graduation recital!”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x13fc
STRING: [Chris] “Ah... Well, there is that too, I suppose...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x142e
STRING: [Phorni] “Stop supposing. You don't have time to
perform random ensembles with me.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x144e
STRING: [Chris] “Even so, I usually have no plans for Saturdays,
and I've played the Fortelle for a whole day, so this is
better than normal, isn't it?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1494
STRING: [Phorni] “That was before the graduation recital came
along. Things are different now.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x14b4
STRING: [Chris] “So, you don't plan on having Sunday ensembles,
either?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x14e6
STRING: [Phorni] “Uh, that's not...

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1514
STRING: That's not the point, you need to focus on getting a
partner starting Monday, got it? No more practicing for
this song.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1534
STRING: [Chris] “Alright... But this Sunday will be the same as
always, right?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1570
STRING: [Phorni] “...Yes.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1586
STRING: Just when I thought she'd get mad again, Phorni
answered honestly, after the slightest hesitation.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x159c
STRING: [Chris] “Good. You should be more open.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x15ce
STRING: [Phorni] “A-Anyway, I don't want to see you coming
back early any more, okay?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x15e4
STRING: [Chris] “...Got it.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1616
STRING: [Phorni] “Promise?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x162c
STRING: [Chris] “Yes, yes.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1658
STRING: As if to hide her embarrassment, Phorni disappeared.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x166e
STRING: Phorni was absolutely right.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x167a
STRING: But I wasn't going to be so compliant.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1686
STRING: What I really wanted to do was make a clean copy of
the score and finish the song.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x169c
STRING: It was true that doing what Phorni said would be best.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x16a8
STRING: I knew that, and so I was somewhat conflicted.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x16b4
STRING: What was I going to do from Monday...

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x16c0
STRING: Or perhaps the real question was: What do I do now?

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x16d6
STRING: I hadn't asked her yet out of fear, but what was Phorni
going to do after I left this place?

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x16ec
STRING: The time would come when I'd have to talk to her
about that.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1770
STRING: [Chris] “Okay, that's all for today. It'll be done in...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x17aa
STRING: [Phorni] “Hey, what's done? Don't tell me that's a new
song you just wrote?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x17ca
STRING: [Chris] “Ph-Phorni, when did you...?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x17fc
STRING: [Phorni] “Just this second, of course. Hmm?

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x182a
STRING: ... You're hiding something, aren't you...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1840
STRING: [Chris] “No... I'm not hiding anything. Just a little
surprised, that's all. I was composing.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x187c
STRING: [Phorni] “Wow, this is a great song. When did you write
it?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1892
STRING: [Chris] “Huh? Er... Very recently, I guess.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x18c4
STRING: [Phorni] “Today's my first time hearing it, so you don't
mean this week, do you? You don't have that kind of
time on your hands.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x18e4
STRING: [Chris] “Ah... Well, you know, things just happen,
Phorni.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x190c
STRING: [Phorni] “So it's true...? Wait, you've come back early a
few times this week, right? So when was it?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1936
STRING: [Chris] “Those days I came back late... I guess.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1968
STRING: [Phorni] “No guessing! This song wasn't written in a day,
no way. Just to be sure... Two days?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1992
STRING: [Chris] “Uh... Yeah, that's about right.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x19c4
STRING: [Phorni] “For the love of... Stop messing around!

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x19f2
STRING: You know you don't have the time for this.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1a08
STRING: [Chris] “Why are you so worried about that, Phorni? I
said it'd be okay.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1a30
STRING: [Phorni] “Where is this unfounded peace of mind
coming from? Both Torta and Arie said you had to
decide soon, right?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1a5a
STRING: [Chris] “But if I'm just playing aimlessly, there's no telling
if something good will come out of it.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1a7a
STRING: [Chris] “That's why writing songs that I want to play will
help my graduation recital, in the end.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1ab6
STRING: [Phorni] “You shouldn't be writing songs without any
definite end in sight, you know that much at least, right?

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1ad6
STRING: [Chris] “Yes, I do. But this one's almost finished.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1b12
STRING: [Phorni] “No means no. From the day after tomorrow,
you'll focus on practicing with your potential partner.
Got it?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1b32
STRING: [Chris] “Got it.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1b50
STRING: [Phorni] “Are you sure? Anyway, you're not allowed to
write new songs until the graduation recital is over.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1b70
STRING: [Chris] “What?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1b86
STRING: Phorni could be really hard-headed sometimes.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1b92
STRING: I know that she's saying all this for my benefit, but I
wrote this song to make her happy...

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1ba8
STRING: [Chris] “If that's what you think, Phorni, then I'll stop.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1bbe
STRING: That's because this song was for Phorni, not anyone
else.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1bca
STRING: If she told me to stop, I had no choice but to stop.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1bf2
STRING: [Phorni] “Good boy.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1c08
STRING: If I told Phorni this song had been written for her, would
she sing it for me, I wonder?

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1c1e
STRING: ... Nah, it'd come off as strangely serious, so she
probably wouldn't say anything.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1c34
STRING: And besides, Phorni was absolutely right about me not
having enough time.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1c62
STRING: [Chris] “This can wait... Until after graduation.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1c78
STRING: I looked at the score, then placed it in the drawer.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1c84
STRING: Just a little wistfully, I heard the melody of the
newly-formed song in my head.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1c9a
STRING: I told myself that I'd come back to it if I had the chance,
and with that excuse, I decided to forget about the
song.
